SMW Subobject for Grand Hallowed Coffin (Looted)Image: File:Grand Hallowed Coffin (looted).pngObject ID: 38839Uses infobox: SceneryIs members only: trueIs variant of: Grand Hallowed Coffin

The Grand Hallowed Coffin can be found at the end of the fifth floor in the Hallowed Sepulchre. It requires 66 Thieving (boostable) to open and grants 200 experience when successfully looted. Reaching the coffin requires 92 Agility (not boostable). The player has unlimited time to loot the coffin (if it was reached within the time limit) once they jump over the pedestal, as the timer will pause by then. Occasionally when failing to loot the coffin, the player will be poisoned.

The strange old lockpick has an increased success chance at opening a coffin when compared to the standard lockpick. It will not use any charges to do this[1].

Upon opening the Grand Hallowed Coffin, there is a 1% chance that the Archpriest of the Unicorn will appear. After speaking to him (with or without an amulet of ghostspeak), he will appear in the Hallowed Sepulchre's lobby if players wear a ring of visibility.

Thieving info[edit | edit source]

Grand Hallowed Coffin
Level required 66
Thieving XP200 xp
TypeChest
ToolLockpick or Strange Old Lockpick

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 440,000 loots from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The Grand Hallowed Coffin rolls the high-tier coffin loot table. It also has a rare chance to give the ring of endurance as a tertiary drop along with its regular drops.[2]

The average Grand Hallowed Coffin loot is worth 246,386.29. Excluding the ring of endurance, the average loot is worth 32,733

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 September 2020
(update)

One of the loot rolls from the Grand Hallowed Coffin has been moved onto another coffin on the fifth level.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Mod Husky. Darkmeyer Improvements. Reddit. 9 June 2020. (Archived from the original on 13 June 2020.) Mod Husky: "did you know that the strange old lockpick already has a higher success rate than a normal one, you can still fail but it's a bit lower"
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Husky's Twitter account. 18 June 2020. (Archived from the original on 18 June 2020.) Mod Husky: "Well, it's my birthday tomorrow and scuffed flames appear to be fixed so I'm in a good mood. As a result here's the ever so requested droprates from the sepulchre put together nicely on these images by @JagexRy"
